title: Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Based Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This paper presents a vision-based reinforcement learning approach for dexterous hand manipulation tasks, achieving high success rates in object reorientation and grasping. The method leverages a novel reward shaping strategy to improve sample efficiency and task generalization.

title: Learning Dexterous Hand Manipulation from Human Demonstrations via Imitation Learning
abstract: This work explores imitation learning for dexterous hand manipulation by leveraging human motion capture data. It introduces a new policy distillation framework that enables the robotic hand to replicate complex human-like movements effectively.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Dexterous Object Manipulation
abstract: This paper proposes a vision-language-action (VLA) model that integrates visual perception, language understanding, and motor control for dexterous object manipulation. The model is trained on a large-scale dataset of human-robot interaction scenarios.

title: Model Predictive Control for Dexterous Robotic Hands
abstract: This paper introduces a model predictive control (MPC) framework tailored for dexterous robotic hands, enabling precise and adaptive control in dynamic manipulation tasks. The approach improves stability and responsiveness during complex object interactions.

title: Optimization-Based Grasp Planning for Dexterous Hands
abstract: This research focuses on optimization techniques for grasp planning in dexterous hands, proposing a novel objective function that balances grasp stability, force distribution, and task-specific constraints.

title: End-to-End Learning for Dexterous Manipulation Using Multi-Modal Imitation Learning
abstract: This paper presents an end-to-end multi-modal imitation learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, combining visual, tactile, and kinematic inputs to achieve robust and accurate control policies.

title: Policy Optimization for Dexterous Manipulation with Continuous Action Spaces
abstract: The paper addresses the challenge of policy optimization in continuous action spaces for dexterous robotic hands, introducing a novel algorithm that enhances exploration and convergence in high-dimensional control tasks.

title: Language-Guided Dexterous Manipulation with Vision-Language-Action Models
abstract: This study explores how language instructions can guide dexterous hand manipulation through vision-language-action models, enabling natural interaction between humans and robotic systems in complex tasks.

title: Efficient Motion Planning for Dexterous Hands Using Gradient-Based Optimization
abstract: This paper presents an efficient motion planning algorithm for dexterous robotic hands based on gradient-based optimization, significantly reducing computation time while maintaining high accuracy in complex manipulation tasks.

title: Learning Dexterous Manipulation Policies with Hierarchical Reinforcement Learning
abstract: This work introduces a hierarchical reinforcement learning framework for dexterous hand manipulation, decomposing complex tasks into subtasks to improve learning efficiency and performance in real-world settings.

title: Behavioral Cloning for Multi-Finger Robot Hands
abstract: This work explores imitation learning techniques for teaching robots complex dexterous manipulation skills through expert demonstrations. We show that our approach can learn intricate manipulation behaviors from limited demonstration data.

title: VLA-Based Dexterous Manipulation Planning
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Vision-Language-Action Models for Hand Manipulation
abstract: We introduce a vision-language-action model specifically designed for dexterous hand manipulation tasks. The model integrates visual perception, natural language understanding, and motor control for improved manipulation capabilities.

title: Adaptive Control Strategies for Dexterous Manipulation
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Real-Time Control of Anthropomorphic Hands
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.

title: Optimal Control for Multi-Fingered Robotic Hands
abstract: This paper presents novel control strategies for coordinated movement of multi-fingered robotic hands in manipulation tasks. Our approach addresses the challenges of high-dimensional control and contact dynamics.
